Solution:

In a distributed system, there are multiple nodes or components that work together to achieve a common goal. A distributed system is designed to be fault-tolerant, meaning that if one node fails or becomes unavailable, the system can continue to operate without interruption. This is in contrast to a centralized system, where all the control and processing is concentrated in a single node or server.
